SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc28
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc28.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc28.model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Game extends Object implements Serializable
this is the most important class of the project, it contains the methods that make playing the game possible, every game ha shis own game class and there are a minimum of 2 to maximum of 4 players per game. In this class there are methods for every phase of the game from start to finish.
See Also:

      public void addPlayerToGame(String name) throws PlayerActionError
      this method adds the player in the parameter in the game only if there are still available spots in the game. it also checks whether the nickname is already taken in the game.
      Parameters:
      name -
      Throws:

    • checkEndGame

      private void checkEndGame()
      This method is responsible for checking if the player who has just placed a card has reached 20 points and in that case it sets up a counter which counts the rounds left.

    • endGame

      private void endGame() throws GameEndedNotification
      this method starts the final part of the game when the objective points are calculated and the winner is announced
      Throws:
      GameEndedNotification

    • playGameCard

      public void playGameCard(String playerName, CardGame playedCard, boolean isFront, Coordinate coordinates) throws PlayerActionError, GameEndedNotification
      this method plays a card in a player table, checks wheather the action requested is valid and sets up the next move to be played
      Parameters:
      playerName - who is playing the card
      playedCard - the card to be played
      isFront - indicate how the card has to be played, front if True, back if False
      coordinates - indicates the coordinate where the card has to be played
      Throws:
      PlayerActionError
      GameEndedNotification

    • calculateObjectivePoints

      private void calculateObjectivePoints()
      This method is responsible for calling '.calculatePoints(objs)' on every player when the game is finished. This is a callback of 'endGame()'

    • calculateWinner

      private void calculateWinner() throws GameEndedNotification
      This method calculates who's the winner at the end of the game. ? maybe add a winner attribute Optional and set winner player.
      Throws:
      GameEndedNotification

    • setupNextMove

      private void setupNextMove() throws GameEndedNotification
      This method sets everything up for the next turn by calling checkEndGame() if roundsLeft has not been set, or endGame() if roundsLeft is zero. It also calls actionManager.nextMove() which updates the next turn's expected action and playerOfTurn.
      Throws:
      GameEndedNotification

    • drawGameCard

      public CardResource drawGameCard(String playerName, boolean fromGoldDeck) throws PlayerActionError
      This method take the card from the top of the deck and add that card to the player's hand
      Parameters:
      playerName - name of playing player
      fromGoldDeck - is a boolean that tells from which deck the card needs to be drawn
      Returns:
      the drawn card
      Throws:
      PlayerActionError

    • drawGameCard

      public void drawGameCard(String playerName, CardResource cardDrawn) throws PlayerActionError
      this method draws a face up card form the table
      Parameters:
      playerName - that draws the card
      cardDrawn - is the chosen card from the player to draw
      Throws:
      PlayerActionError

      this method is used to inform clients the expected action form the player of turn.

    • getWinners

      public ArrayList<Player> getWinners()
      Returns array of winners. If array is empty, then the game is still on going. If there's more than one winner, then the game ended in a draw.
